meanings.definition: To twist or turn with force
meanings.sent1: She was torquing the lid off the jar with all her strength.
meanings.sent2: He torqued the screwdriver to tighten the loose screw.
meanings.sent3: The robot started torquing its body in a dance-like motion.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was torquing through the town, causing destruction.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler torqued his opponent's arm to gain the upper hand.

meanings.definition: The measure of a force's tendency to rotate an object around an axis
meanings.sent1: The engineer calculated the torquing force needed to rotate the wheel.
meanings.sent2: The torque of the motor helped spin the propeller of the plane.
meanings.sent3: The torquing of the merry-go-round made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The torquing of the Earth's axis affects the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The torquing of the wrench loosened the stubborn bolt.

meanings.definition: The act of applying torque to tighten or loosen a bolt
meanings.sent1: He used a wrench for the torquing of the bolt on the machine.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic's precise torquing ensured the car's parts were secure.
meanings.sent3: The torquing of the screw made a satisfying clicking sound.
meanings.sent4: She demonstrated the proper torquing technique during the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The torquing of the nut required a specific amount of force.
